p:
Beside the oviposition deterrence, A. verlotiorum, L. dentata, and R. chalepensis EOs showed larvicidal activity against Ae. albopictus, with R. chalepensis that was significantly more toxic than the other two EOs. The toxicity of R. chalepensis EO tested in this work was, however, lower than the one of the EO extracted from Tunisian cultivated R. chalepensis plants (LC 50 = 33.18 μL L −1)
36 but, overall, in the range of the LC 50 values (LC 50 range = 11–194 μL L −1) reported for 22 plant species EOs against Ae. albopictus larvae in previous works (reviewed by Pavela
45 ).
